intro: Campylocentrum antioquiense, commonly known as the Antioquian starfruit, is a species of flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Marcgraviaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and glossy, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit, which is edible, has a unique flavor and is used in local cuisines.
